Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Norah Chase Papers on the City University of New York Professional Staff Congress
Chase, Norah C.
Chase, Norah C.
WAG.122
0.25 Linear Feet (1 folder)
1999-2000 Materials are in English 1
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Nora Chase Papers; WAG 122; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Norah Chase was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Nora Chase at an unknown date. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.078.
Scope and Contents
Norah Chase, an associate professor of English at Kingsborough Community College in Brooklyn, N.Y., and a long-time activist in the Professional Staff Congress (PSC), the labor union representing college teachers in the City University of New York system, donated these materials. This collection contains copies of Unity News, pamphlets, flyers, correspondence, and meeting minutes related to the 2000 election of PSC officers and representatives by Chase and other members of the union's Unity Caucus.
